p: Ash represents the total mineral content of a sample, made by inorganic components. The Fedora cv. contained an average of 5.3 g 100 g −1 ( Table 1) ashes, in agreement with Vonapartis et al. [ 17], who reported ash values ranging from 5.1 to 5.8 g 100 g −1 in hemp seeds from ten different cultivars.
